data.event: Madison County was established on December 13, 1808 by the governor of the Mississippi Territory.
It is recognized as the "birthplace" of Alabama, which was founded there on December 14, 1819.
This changed when a group of German rocket scientists, led by Wernher von Braun, came to Redstone Arsenal in 1950.
Tens of thousands of jobs came to the area as a result of the Space Race, and the population of Madison County rose from 72,903 in 1950 to an estimated 2014 population of 350,299.
